title: Mom outraged after school photographer offers airbrushing for eight year-olds
text:
Broadcaster Sam Walker was appalled to receive an order form for her eight year-old daughter’s school photos complete with two levels of optional extra airbrushing (Pictures: Sam Walker/Twitter)

A mother has hit out at a photographer who offered to airbrush her eight year-old daughter’s annual school photograph.

Journalist Sam Walker, who lives in Phoenix, Arizona, shared a snap of the offending order form on Twitter Monday.

It offers parents and carers the option of basic or premium retouching.

The basic option ‘removes blemishes,’ while the pricier premium alternative also ‘whitens teeth and evens skin tone,’ according to the form.

Sam, who moved to Arizona from the UK earlier this year tweeted: ‘The girls have their school photo today and there is the option to AIRBRUSH the picture!

The girls have their school photo today and there is the option to AIRBRUSH the picture! There are two levels offered!! What the….?! Have complained! What 8 yr old needs to be paranoid about an “uneven skin tone” pic.twitter.com/6BGCx3FRZ9 — Sam Walker (@WalkerSam) October 28, 2019

‘There are two levels offered!! What the….?!

‘Have complained! What 8 yr old needs to be paranoid about an “uneven skin tone”.’

Sam did not name her daughter’s school, the photographer, or share how much the controversial optional extras cost.

Other parents replied to say their children’s school had made the same offer, or even appeared to tweak their children’s photos without asking.

It comes amid fears taking the perfect selfie for social media is making young children overly worried about their appearance.

Metro US has contacted Sam for further comment.
description: Broadcaster Sam Walker was appalled to spot the optional extras on the order form for her eight year-old daughter's school snaps
